FormattedText.htmlText: Use the reference URL or a preconfigured one from https://go.sap.corp/MCC-MDR as a starting point.
Replace the parameters in the URL with your own values to create a direct URL to 'your' MCC Dashboard.

Available parameters for each dashboard are provided either by the Dashboard Builder and Analyzer or on the documentation pages for each dashboard (button 'More Information' on the right side of the header of each dashboard).
Often filters use technical names as selection criteria.
To find out the technical names of a field switch on the technical names in CRM WebUI:
- Personalize (Menu on top of the screen)
- Dropdown Lists --> Flag 'Show keys in dropdown lists'
- Filters need to be placed first, followed by parameters.
- In MDR6, MDR6A, MDR7 and MDR8, use the 'service_team' filter when combining service teams with 'OR'.
- In MDR6, MDR6A, MDR7 and MDR8, use the 'service_team_1' and 'service_team_2' filters when combining service teams with 'AND'.
- In MDR6, MDR6A, MDR7 and MDR8, use the 'service_team_2' filter should only be used together with 'service_team_1' filter.
- The time unit of parameters refreshInterval (minutes) and flipInterval (seconds) cannot be changed.
- All URLs can be modified manually after generation.
